bug.short_desc: gdal-2.1.0-5.fc25 FTBFS: Installed (but unpackaged) file(s) found: /usr/etc/bash_completion.d/gdal-bash-completion.sh
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
gdal-2.1.0-5.fc25 fails to build in F25 if bash-completion package is installed:
make[1]: Entering directory '/builddir/build/BUILD/gdal-2.1.0-fedora/scripts' if test "x`pkg-config --version 2>/dev/null`" != "x" -a "x`pkg-config --variable=compatdir bash-completion`" != "x"; then \ /builddir/build/BUILD/gdal-2.1.0-fedora/install-sh -d /builddir/build/BUILDROOT/gdal-2.1.0-6.fc25.x86_64/usr`pkg-config --variable=compatdir bash-completion` ; \ cp gdal-bash-completion.sh /builddir/build/BUILDROOT/gdal-2.1.0-6.fc25.x86_64/usr`pkg-config --variable=compatdir bash-completion`; \ fi make[1]: Leaving directory '/builddir/build/BUILD/gdal-2.1.0-fedora/scripts' [...] Checking for unpackaged file(s): /usr/lib/rpm/check-files /builddir/build/BUILDROOT/gdal-2.1.0-6.fc25.x86_64 error: Installed (but unpackaged) file(s) found: /usr/etc/bash_completion.d/gdal-bash-completion.sh Installed (but unpackaged) file(s) found: /usr/etc/bash_completion.d/gdal-bash-completion.sh
bash-completion is a weak dependency of bash.
I recommend to build-require bash-completion and package the files without run-requiring bash-completion <https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Packaging:Guidelines#The_directory_is_owned_by_a_package_which_is_not_required_for_your_package_to_function>.
This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 25 development cycle. Changing version to '25'.
